p: A smaller set of control and response actions at the human-animal interface considered the environmental outcomes (see Table 4 ; a more detailed version of Table 3 and Table 4 can be found in supplementary material B). These include the banning and monitoring of animal transport and trade to avoid the zoonotic bridging in a food system related-environment [ 45, 57, 63], increased awareness of personal hygienic measures in occupational settings [ 50, 52], vaccination and monitoring of domestic animals to reduce shedding the viruses to the environment [ 38, 47, 51, [64], [65], [66]], bio-surveillance in wet markets [ 37, 61], and public education on zoonosis [ 37, 46, 54].
